intro: Drimia cyanelloides, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms during the warmer months. Drimia cyanelloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
